intro: Synsepalum kemoense, commonly known as the Kemo miracle fruit, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Cameroon and is characterized by its distinctive, fleshy, red-colored fruits that contain a single seed. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and elliptical in shape, with a smooth margin. The flowers are small and yellow, clustered in racemes, and are followed by the unique, fleshy fruits that are used in traditional medicine and as a flavoring agent.
